citation.article-title: Malonomonas rubra gen. nov. sp. nov., a microaerotolerant anaerobic bacterium growing by decarboxylation of malonate.

p.s: Malonomonas (Ma.lo.no.mo'nas. M.L.n. acidum malonicum malonic acid; Gr.f.n. monas a monad or unit; Malonomonas M.L.f.n. a malonic acid utilizing monad)
Straight to slightly curved rods with rounded ends, 0.4 X 3.1-4.0 μm in size, singly, in pairs, short chains, or large aggregates.
Motile in young cultures by polar flagellal Gram-negative, non-sporeforming.
Malohate decarboxylated to acetate, fumarate or malate fermented to succinate and CO2.
No other organic acids, sugars, or alcohols utilized.
Neither nitrate, N2O, sulfate, thiosulfate, sulfite, nor sulfur reduced.
Growth in mineral medium requires at least 150 mM NaCl.
Indole not formed, gelatin, urea, or esculin not hydrolyzed; weak catalase and cytochrome oxidase activity.
Selective enrichment in salt water medium with malonate as substrate, pH range: 6.0 - 8.5, optimum at 7.1 - 7.3.
High amounts of periplasmic cytochrome c, small amounts of membrane-bound cytochrome b.
Habitat: anoxic mud of marine origin.
Type strain: GraMal1, DSM 5091; deposited in Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen, Braunschweig, FRG.
Only existing species so far: M. rubra.
Genus description so far identical with species description.
